metadata.synopsis: Dialog for one of the zombie beggars. After player talks to Father Carrion and has been tasked to kill them, they will react to this and either run to warn their leader, Thrumbo, or confront player. The following states are one-liners and hasmets for each possible quest state (meeting with thrumbo, outside house and inside father carrion's house once fully killed.)
metadata.how_to_trigger: Talk to Sacrum in CTY_Main_A near -75; 20; -93

18.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
18.text: A toast to your kindness! And to Carrion rotting in his grave!

20.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
20.text: So, you came through for us in the end. Bravo!

29.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
29.text: Yes. Um, alms for the poor?
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Puts out his hands in a begging gestureNodeContext: Nervous, putting on his best begging voice.

85.speaker: Narrator
85.text: *That smell again - fetid flesh and bone. This is another of Mystic Carrion's runaways.*

69.speaker: Narrator
69.text: *That smell again - fetid flesh and bone. This is another zombie.*

0.speaker: Narrator
0.text: *An air of decay hangs over the stooped beggar's form, the same that tainted Mystic Carrion's chambers. This is one of his runaway servants.*

19.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
19.text: Anything you can spare for a humble beggar?

71.speaker: Player
71.text: I didn't know zombies liked their fruit and vegetables?

59.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
59.text: A zombie? Oh no - a touch of scurvy, that's all. Nothing a basket of fruit wouldn't solve, could I afford one...
59.context: NodeContext: Nervous lies, leading into a new, subtler appeal for money

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Have you seen Thrumbo? Mystic Carrion is looking for him.

15.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
15.context: NodeContext: Horrified - he's been caught out

55.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
55.text: Afraid I can't help you. I've lost track of him myself. Took a wrong turn somewhere and poof, he was gone.

2.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
2.text: And that's the truth. I never lie.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: You're protecting your friend, I understand. But you can trust me - I promise.

13.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
13.text: You do seem the honest type. I can always tell.

9.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
9.text: Thrumbo had a plan. He was going to find us an abandoned house, somewhere to hide away from Carrion.

8.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
8.text: But I haven't heard from him since. Lots of empty houses to check, you see.

57.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
57.text: You have to search them thoroughly. Especially the wardrobes - Thrumbo said that's the smartest place to hide.
57.context: NodeContext: Justifying himself, not realising this is valuable information

45.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
45.text: No, no I don't think so. My lips are sealed.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: This is important. I need to find your friend - someone's life is at stake.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Tell me, or spend the rest of your miserable existence waiting for my knife to slit your throat.

91.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
91.text: Ah. So that's how it is? Very well.
91.context: NodeContext: Clearing his throat, trying to sound confident dealing with you

46.speaker: Player
46.text: I've hunted monsters, beggar. And I won't hesitate to make you my next kill.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: I'll crush your bones to dust, beggar - tell me what you know.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: You'll lose your head in a minute unless you tell me what you know.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: I've heard more than one confession in my time. Tell me what you know - it'll lighten the load.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: You words say one thing, your face another. I see your lies, so let us dispense with them.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: Tell me what you remember, and I might be able to find him for you.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Would a donation to your escape fund reassure you? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

32.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
32.text: Yes, amazing. It's all coming back to me.
32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands gold to Sacrum (unseen)

1.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
1.text: Glad we could get that all straightened out.
1.context: NodeContext: Relieved this is going no further

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Cut the act. Tell me where Thrumbo is hiding.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Thrumbo is dead. I killed him.

22.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
22.text: You - you did? Why did you do that, you vicious creature?

23.speaker: Player
23.text: An ear, if you're willing to tell me your tale. How did you end up here?

6.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
6.text: That devil, drink! I spent it all.
6.context: NodeContext: Mournful, lamenting - a tad overdramatic

52.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
52.text: All behind me, of course. Now I only require the gold for, ah, sustenance.
52.context: NodeContext: Realises he's given away too much, collecting himself

90.speaker: Player
90.text: An ear, if you're willing to tell me your tale. How did you end up here?

7.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
7.text: I will see that it is put to good use. A crate of apples perhaps, or a bottle of wine...

79.speaker: Player
79.text: Give generously. The man is clearly in desperate need. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Give generously. The man is clearly in desperate need. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

33.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
33.text: You'd really give so much? Thank you.

24.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
24.text: My brothers will be most surprised. I usually return with empty pockets.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: I'm sorry, my purse is rather light at present.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I'm sorry, I've nothing to spare.

81.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
81.text: Times are hard for us all. But we must persevere!
81.context: NodeContext: Trying to make the player feel better

48.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
48.text: My brothers are depending on me.
48.context: NodeContext: Proud of the responsibility he's been given

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Earn your keep, beggar. The rest of us have to.

50.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
50.text: I am trying! But people haven't the gold to spare, it seems.
50.context: NodeContext: Doesn't want to believe people are so selfish as to not help him

26.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
26.text: People were more generous in days gone by.
26.context: NodeContext: Saddened, recalling his previous life

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Earn your keep, beggar. The rest of us have to.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Look closer. See what truly ails this pungent beggar.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Sniff the area, expanding your senses. Try to identify the smell.

64.speaker: Narrator
64.text: *Your divine power focuses on the beggar - revealing the magic that sustains him. This man is a corpse - a zombie.*

63.speaker: Narrator
63.text: *Beneath his ragged clothing, you catch a glimpse of rotten flesh - more than any living being could sustain. This man is a zombie.*

73.speaker: Narrator
73.text: *You try to focus on the beggar, but the smell is too strong, too nauseating. Perhaps the cause is better left unknown.*

31.speaker: Player
31.text: The divine tugs at you. Give in, letting your god flow through you.

56.speaker: Narrator
56.text: *An air of decay hangs over the stooped beggar's form. The smell of rot. The smell of death.*

37.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
37.text: I hope wherever Thrumbo's hiding, he's comfortable. Nothing worse than a tight squeeze.

86.speaker: Narrator
86.text: *You recall where you've smelled this beggar's rotten musk before - in Mystic Carrion's chambers. This is one of the runaways he seeks.*

38.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
38.text: Anything you can lend will be most gratefully received.

54.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
54.text: My thanks to you - your gold will be most gratefully spent.
54.context: NodeContext: Gracious, overly fawning - hiding nerves

70.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
70.text: I'm afraid I've nothing more to tell you. Don't forget to check under the bed!

83.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
83.text: Can't a man earn some gold in peace?

84.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
84.text: A home at last - this calls for a toast! Now where did that old miser keep the wine?

89.speaker: Strange Beggar Sacrum
89.text: Spare a coin for a lost soul?
89.context: NodeContext: Nervous, putting on his best begging voice.
